RESTAURANTS

[/vc_column_text][vc_empty_space][/vc_column][/vc_row][vc_row css_animation=”” row_type=”row” use_row_as_full_screen_section=”no” type=”full_width” angled_section=”no” text_align=”left” background_image_as_pattern=”without_pattern” z_index=””][vc_column css=”.vc_custom_1575835851507{padding-left: 0px !important;}”][vc_column_text css=”.vc_custom_1684311986572{background-color: #ffffff !important;}” el_class=”content-section curved-bottom-right space16″]

STUDENTS’  MEALS/ FOOD ID 

The University of West Attica, in order to ensure the catering of the meals to the students  operates currently  3 student restaurants located at the 3 campuses of the University.  The   restaurants provide to the students breakfast, lunch and dinner. The students’ restaurants are open daily and during the weekends and the public holidays from the 1st of September until the 30th of June of each academic year, except   the Christmas holidays  and Easter holidays.

According to the current legislation, the students of the University of West Attica are entitled to apply for free meals. The students who are not eligible for free meals can eat to the students  restaurants, paying a low daily rate for a full menu (lunch and dinner).

Further information regarding the free meals beneficiaries, the application procedure and the required documentation are provided to the students in the beginning of each academic year by the competent Directorate of Student Care.

 

Entrance to the Application for the Food ID

The University of West Attica, in order to ensure the catering of the meals to the students  operates currently  3 student restaurants located at the 3 campuses of the University.  The   restaurants provide to the students breakfast, lunch and dinner. The students’ restaurants are open daily and during the weekends and the public holidays from the 1st of September until the 30th of June of each academic year, except  the Christmas holidays  and Easter holidays.

According to the current legislation, the students of the University of West Attica are entitled to apply for free meals ID. The students who are not eligible for free meals can eat to the  student restaurants, paying a low daily rate for a full menu (lunch and dinner).

Further information regarding the free meals beneficiaries, the application procedure and the required documentation are provided to the students at the beginning of the each academic year by the competent Directorate of Student Care.

[/vc_column_text][/vc_column][/vc_row]
